column4: If you loved The Night Circus, you might enjoy The Starless Sea by the same author, Erin Morgenstern!
Check out The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue by V.E. Schwab. It's beautifully written and immersive.
Try The Decagon House Murders by Yukito Ayatsuji. It's an incredible mystery with a unique premise.
Circe by Madeline Miller is a great modern take on mythology and ancient literature.
You should explore Hyperion Cantos by Dan Simmons—it's an intricate and breathtaking sci-fi universe.
Check out The Kiss Quotient by Helen Hoang. It's a heartwarming romance with great characters.
Try Red, White & Royal Blue by Casey McQuiston if you haven't already. It's so much fun!
Beneath a Scarlet Sky by Mark Sullivan is a beautifully told historical fiction based on a true story.
Sapiens by Yuval Noah Harari is an outstanding read about the history of humankind.
Try Why We Sleep by Matthew Walker—it’s a fascinating exploration of sleep and its importance.
The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo by Stieg Larsson is an intense and gripping thriller.
You might enjoy Milk and Honey by Rupi Kaur for modern, heartfelt poetry.
For an epic fantasy, try The First Law Trilogy by Joe Abercrombie—it’s dark and captivating.
Try Mexican Gothic by Silvia Moreno-Garcia. It's atmospheric and chilling!
The Haunting of Hill House by Shirley Jackson is a classic that never fails to scare.
Steve Jobs by Walter Isaacson is an inspiring biography of the visionary tech leader.
The Innovators by Walter Isaacson dives into the history of tech innovation and its pioneers.
AI Superpowers by Kai-Fu Lee is an eye-opening book about AI and global competition in tech.
Six of Crows by Leigh Bardugo is an exciting YA novel with amazing characters and plot twists.
You might love The Hate U Give by Angie Thomas for its impactful story and relatable themes.
The Thing Around Your Neck by Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie is a brilliant collection of short stories.
